cheatsheet.title: Add an Event Handler to deal with the problem

intro.description: The following steps show you how an Event Handler can be used to select the checkbox and continue with the test.

item.title: Add an Event Handler to the Test Case

subitem.label: In the Test Case Browser, open the category: "unbound_modules_concrete/Actions(basic)/Click"
Drag the Test Case "ub_grc_clickLeft_single" into the Event Handler area in the Test Case Editor for the "Check if checkbox is selected" Test Case.

In the dialog that appears, specify "Check Failed" as the error type and "Retry" as the reentry type. Leave the amount of retries at 1. Click OK. This means that the Event Handler will be activated when a check failed action occurs. Once the Event Handler has been executed, the failed step will be retried.
In the component names view for the Event Handler, enter the same name as you entered for the checkbox component i.e. TechnicsTab_Bonus_btc

item.title: Execute the test
item.description:
Save the Test Case Editor and re-execute the test. You will see that the Event Handler selects the checbox and then re-performs the failed action (i.e. the check). This is successful the second time, and the test can continue.
If you execute the test a second time without deselecting the checkbox, you will see that the Event Handler does not get activated, as no error occurs.
